subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... I would like to add that according to my personal experience, composition is hardly ever used, and therefore adds unnecessary complexity (and we do not
messageBody:
On Jun 21, 2005, at 11:16 AM, Kent Beck wrote:

> I see what you mean. However, one of our goals in JUnit 4 was to
> remove the
> recursive composition of tests. It is difficult to explain and
> difficult to
> support properly in test runners.

I would like to add that according to my personal experience,
composition is hardly ever used, and therefore adds unnecessary
complexity (and we do not like this, do we?)

One could group tests (if needed) in the UI - by class and by
package, without any need to have composition tools. We do this
routinely in our SEUnit (Objective-C) clone.

Just my â‚¬0.02

Georg Tuparev
